result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's Prison Inmate funds are to be paid toward restitution owed, per prison policy..//..Court strongly recommends to DOC that given the def's desires for treatment and change, the eligibility for both CIP and ERP be as quick as possible
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co. case 11CF113
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to pay restitution of $80 on Joint & Several basis with co-defendant

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the DA's office (see 'other' above)

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

No Contact with any known users or dealers of illicit drugs or controlled substances
.

Def is to follow-through with assessment, recommendation & programming deemed appropriate by the PO in correlation with the Needs Assessment done with his case

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed

State by Skemp / Def in custody w/ Atty Joseph Randtke
All parties have reviewed PSI - no factual corrections
PSI SEALED PER CRT ORDER
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 3 1/2 yrs:
- Initial Term of Confinement is 2 yrs w/ credit for 79 days Concurrent w/ 11CF113  - Def is eligible for CIP & ERP
- Extended Supervision is 18 mos w/ conditions:  Def to follow-thru w/ assessment recommendations & Programming deemed approp by PO in correlation w/ the Needs Assessment done w/ his case;  No Contact w/ any known drug users or dealers;  Do not possess or consume any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription;  Obtain & maintain employment;  CRT strongly recommends to DOC that given the desires for trmt & change that def is eligible for both those programs (CIP & ERP) as quick as possible;  Def to pay restitution of $80 Joint & Severally  w/ co-def;  Pay CC & DOC fees

Def w/Atty Randtke
Keller: state has no objection to Def's req to have sig bond revoked - he has already plead guilty
CRT: bond is revoked & he is remanded to custody
